abstract: The plant in Fremont, Calif., which employs 4,700, opened in 1984, partly as a way for G.M. to learn Japanese techniques.
snippet: The plant in Fremont, Calif., which employs 4,700, opened in 1984, partly as a way for G.M. to learn Japanese techniques.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Toyota’s directors voted Thursday to close the company’s only unionized plant in the United States, a joint venture with General Motors in California that G.M. abandoned as part of its recent bankruptcy.

headline.main: Toyota to Close Union Plant in California
headline.print_headline: Toyota Says It Will Close Its Only Unionized Plant in the U.S. After Its Partner G.M. Dropped Out
